name: Suncalc-2
headerDisplay:
This version of the Suncalc platform has been rewritten to support recent versions of HomeKit and the Home app.

Instead of creating one custom accessory to hold all values (which is no longer natively supported), it creates one occupancy sensor for each Suncalc period, making it suitable for using with automations without requiring a separate custom Home app. Multiple locations are supported, but must have unique names.
footerDisplay:
If you have ideas on how to improve this plugin, please feel free to fork and create a PR

Support via BuyMeACoffee

instances.title: Suncalc Instances
instances.description: Add one or more locations to monitor solar events.

name.title: Location Name
name.description: Unique name for this location (e.g., Home, Cabin). This prefix will be added to all sensors.

mode.title: Sensor Mode
mode.description: Choose how many solar sensors to create for this location.

oneOf.title: Basic (Day / Night)
oneOf.description: Creates only day and night sensors.

oneOf.title: Extended (Common periods)
oneOf.description: Creates day/night plus golden hour and other commonly used periods.

location.title: Coordinates
location.description:
Latitude and longitude for sun calculation

Click here to open a site that can help you determine your coordinates

offset.title: Sunrise/Sunset Offset
offset.description:
Optional offsets in minutes, applied only to sunrise and sunset sensors.

For instance, if you want to trigger a scene to start 30 minutes before sunset, you can specify a sunsetStart offset of -30. This fires the trigger 30 minutes earlier than normal.
